data.text: @TimBoSlice570 @willahmed @Buccigross Perhaps, you haven't heard but there are some downsides to actually catching Covid as well. Buddy. 🙄
@david_linklater @willahmed @Buccigross Please check page 30. There is a downside buddy. You’re just too blind to read actual science. https://t.co/6utiAShUHw

@TimBoSlice570 @willahmed @Buccigross Those numbers are contingent on the infected person surviving the infection. Since vaccination improves survival rates, it increases the chances of the previously infected person taking advantage of the added natural immunity. There's still no downside to being vaccinated.

@david_linklater @willahmed @Buccigross Antibodies derived from natural infection with COVID-19 are more abundant and more potent – at least 10 times more potent – than immunity generated by vaccination alone, according to a study from Oregon Health & Science University (OHSU) in Portland. https://t.co/T7eCDR0oWs

@TimBoSlice570 @willahmed @Buccigross Masks and lockdowns were a stopgap until the wide implementation of the vaccines which have been highly successful at preventing severe illness and death. "Natural immunity" didn't exactly do its intended job either considering almost a million Americans died.

@david_linklater @willahmed @Buccigross Not saying people didn’t die from covid. We have the most unhealthy country in the world! Masks, lockdowns, and vaccines didn’t do their intended job. There were a number of therapeutics available for those who were sick.  Dr’s said stay home until you need a ventilator!
@willahmed @skathire But all those positive cases from at-home tests aren’t being reported…
@willahmed @Buccigross Soooo many people will be apoplectic about this though
@TimBoSlice570 @willahmed @Buccigross Try explaining that logic to the unvaccinated thousands who died from Delta. Or died from Omicron, for that matter.
